Description: Small marl pottery jar with flat base, cylindrical body with slightly convex sides, everted ledge-rim, and two pierced tubular-handles; the entire exterior including the base and rim is decorated with fine irregular spots of red paint in imitation of variegated stone.
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (p. 69; pl. xxxv.6)
Condition: fair (rim chipped, one quarter missing); paint worn away on one side.
